32.fullDescription:
A possible integer underflow exists in the function `withdraw(uint256)`.
The subtraction may result in a value < 0.
32.name: ArithmeticVulnerability

24.fullDescription: A reachable exception (opcode 0xfe) has been detected. This can be caused by type errors, division by zero, out-of-bounds array access, or assert violations. This is acceptable in most situations. Note however that `assert()` should only be used to check invariants. Use `require()` for regular input checking.
24.name: OtherVulnerability

fullDescription.text:
A possible integer underflow exists in the function `withdraw(uint256)`.
The subtraction may result in a value < 0.

A reachable exception (opcode 0xfe) has been detected. This can be caused by type errors, division by zero, out-of-bounds array access, or assert violations. This is acceptable in most situations. Note however that `assert()` should only be used to check invariants. Use `require()` for regular input checking.
